subject: Learning
title: What Is Interleaving?
description: A quick, practical guide to What Is Interleaving?.

hook.text: Baseball players who practice pitches in random order outperform those who practice one pitch type at a time.

buildup.text: Interleaving means mixing different types of problems or topics during practice instead of studying them in blocks.

discovery.text: It works because interleaving forces you to discriminate between problem typesâ€”a skill blocked practice never develops.

twist.text: Interleaved practice feels slower and messier. Students rate it less effectiveâ€”yet it produces better outcomes.

climax.text: The extra effort of switching between topics builds stronger, more flexible knowledge structures.

punchline.text: Mix it up. The confusion during practice becomes clarity during the test.

quiz.question: Why does interleaving improve learning?
options: It forces discrimination between problem types, building flexible knowledge
It makes practice easier and more enjoyable
Blocked practice has never been shown to work
